title: Twitter
content:
Recently, after everything that's been going on with the platform, and the recent resurgence of users going to Tumblr, I decided to stop posting to my Twitter indefinitely. Since I left and moved to the Tumblr blog I made back in 2016-ish things've been a lot better art-wise, atmosphere's a lot nicer without the constant fight for attention and this insatiable need people on Twitter feel to cause as much drama as humanly possible, and the unending "hey, remember that group of people who consider you sub-human garbage? I need to remind you about them daily for extra internet points" posts are becoming a detriment to my mental health. Sometimes I just need to ignore those people exist for a while y'know?

Besides that, stuff's been moving along a lot smoother there than it did on Twitter. I'm sitting at about 40 followers now, and the exact same engagement rate I had on Twitter with over 400. Besides just that one statistic people are actually *interacting*, doing more than just clicking the like button and moving on, it feels nice

I think I'll be staying on Tumblr for a while, with my second page staying where it's always been. Unless Twitter somehow pulls a 180 and becomes something other than an unbearable cesspit of hatred I'll be staying there, or somewhere else if I find a better alternative

title: Redesign
content: The old site design was kinda hard to read and didn't really fit the style I wanted, so I spent some time on it this week and made it look more how I wanted it to. Gonna upload more recent art to the art page soon

title: Javascript!
content: Instead of being weird static code, this page is all automatically generated by a couple lines of javascript I tossed together as practice. Less strenuous on the backend than having php load something that simple, and I got to try some stuff - Also there's an art page now

title: What now?
content: I dunno, don't really know what I wanna do with these couple of pages now - I'll think of something later

title: Art
content: I think I've been drawing for about 7 years now, doesn't feel like I've gotten very far but my friends tell me otherwise so maybe I'm wrong - Still got a long way to go until my art skills are where I want them to be - My twitter page (the one I post in the most often), my deviantart page, and my github page (for my programming projects and also this website), are all stored in the "Link Zone" page at the top of this one

title: Programming
content: Programming is another one of those things that I only like doing for fun, although I still do it at work a lot - My biggest project so far is Kit (name change pending), a discord bot that's been my outlet for the past 5 years or so while I learned how to use Javascript - Her and all her ugly code is available on my github page
